titleStmt.title: The poesie of floured prayers Containing sundrie meditations and prayers gathered out of the sacred letters and vertuous writers: disposed in forme of the alphabet, of the most vertuous Lady, the Lady Elizabeths name. Set forth by Sir Iohn Convvay.
Meditations and praiers gathered out of the sacred letters and vertuous writers
titleStmt.author: Conway, John, Sir, d. 1603.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed [by T. Purfoot] for Va. Sims, and are to be sold by Ed: White,

notesStmt.note: The first and last leaves are blank.
Running title: The poesie of flowred prayers.
Caption title on sig. R1v: Sententiæ diuinæ. This section is in Latin.
Omits the REGINA prayers and inserts new ones beginning LADT or LADIE before those on ELIZABETH. Also adds the Litany and suffrages.--STC.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
